result.title: Jodi Rolland Joins U.S. Bank Wealth Management as President, Affluent Wealth Management
result.text: MINNEAPOLIS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--U.S. Bancorp announced that on Sept. 22, 2025, veteran wealth management leader Jodi Rolland joined the company as President, Affluent Wealth Management and will assume the role of CEO for U.S. Bancorp Investments (USBI) and U.S. Bancorp Advisors (USBA), with the effective date to be announced. In this role, Rolland oversees the nationwide network of U.S. Bank Wealth Management Affluent financial professionals of U.S Bank and its affiliates, USBI and USBA. Rolland.

result.title: U.S. Bancorp: 2 Years Later, My Rating Is Still A Buy
result.text: U.S. Bancorp remains undervalued despite a 60% share price rise, supported by growth catalysts and a strong dividend yield. Lower interest rates could rapidly reduce USB's unrealized losses, boosting tangible book value and share price if inflation remains stable. USB's diversification into payments and asset management provides higher profitability, less cyclicality, and positions USB for growth as the U.S. economy expands.

result.title: Christopher Paulison to Join U.S. Bank as Kandace Heck Retires
result.text: MINNEAPOLIS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Christopher Paulison to join U.S. Bank as Kandace Heck retires.

result.title: CFPB Puts Early Stop to Monitoring of Apple and US Bank
result.text: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau reportedly ended settlements with Apple and U.S. Bank, putting a stop to monitoring that was initially set to last for years. In both cases, the settlements were reached during the Biden administration, and the companies paid the full civil money penalty that their settlements included, Reuters reported Tuesday (Sept.

result.title: A Crisis of Confidence is Reshaping the American Dream, U.S. Bank Survey Finds
result.text: MINNEAPOLIS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--A new survey from U.S. Bank found that many Americans are making smart, responsible choices  budgeting, investing, cutting back on spending. But many feel progress is increasingly elusive because the goals most people care about  buying a home, retiring comfortably, building wealth  depend on economic forces beyond their control. However, the survey found that financial planning and professional advice significantly improve confidence and feelings of control. Th.
